column4: everex stepnote nc 1502 not found on /hardwareSupportMachines - works fine during install just want to make install settings stick after restart...
its using the file: "xorg.conf.new" can anyone help me to set it up correctly?
sar is your friend it will gives you plenty of information if you don't like it try ksar a graphical frontend
not familiar with sar can you hip me to it as I am a fresh around here
i assume you mean type sar into terminal to get the info I need?
command tells me i need to get 1 of 2 packages - sysstat or atsar which is the preferred choice?
systat
you drive is not dying no ?
all recent harddirves support smartd
a must read http://www.linuxjournal.com/content/know-when-your-drives-are-failing-smartd
failed to fetch http://...  - any other cmd to get the packages
harddrive failing is that your take on the problem...?
no but who knows a harddrive that dy is something frequeent

as weird as it sounds that would almost be easier to deal with than having a picture perfect install only to reboot to the Twilight zone on your screen - so I assume failed to fetch means that the machine cant access the net or the files are no longer at that location?
yeah that's the message i got
sorry to ask again what happens if you type : sudo apt-get install sysstat
final message is "could not resolve 'us.archive.ubuntu.com'
it seems it was unable to get all that it needed as 40.8kb of archives were needed and it gave that error mssg
is the machine you are using irc ?
no I am using another machine for this irc - the other could access net during install though
seems it lost connection
my hunch is to figure out a way to make the settings that the machine used during install to stick after the restart. any tips on getting that to work
I read that using the cmd "sudo gedit /boot/grub/menu.lst" might get the settings to stick but I get an error mssg when I enter that  not sure why though
